Entries.default: "Welcome one and welcome all! Buy me a bottle, and I'll be your finest loving pal." She hiccups into her fist, then pounds it on her chest to loose an impressive belch.

"Might that be my sweetest new crony, bringing me a fresh cask of bitter booze? I tell you, chum, we're mates by spirit if not by ship!"

The pirate whips her head around at your approach, swaying slightly on her feet.
"Well, if it ain't my fond and feckless friend! Wait, no, I didn't mean that. My tongue gets a tad twisted when I'm too far into the cups."
"Black pox me!"
"Looking to share more tipple and conversation? I'm happy enough to oblige."
"What says you, lad?"

"I never thought you could really get the better of Ben. I swear it.

"Bloody wounds, I'll be a dead woman if Aeldys ever finds out what I did..."
"How are things around Fort Deadlight?"
"Feeling okay?"
"I have the special stew."
"Is this the right rum?"
"What was it I needed to draw Benweth to the Court?"
"What do we need to get a ruckus started?"
"Say I wanted to draw Benweth down here..."
"I'm looking for Benweth."
"Why's Benweth avoiding the fort's common areas?"
"Farewell."
"Quieter than usual. I guess, I have you to blame for that." She shrugs, lifting her mug.
"Right as rain, why? From the party? I never feel bad afterwards. The trick is to puke before you pass out."

"Hurrah, you! Things sure are looking grand here."

She leans forward to sniff the steaming stew and nearly topples into the cask.
"And they're about to get better."
"Distribute the stew!"
"Only way to know for sure is to give it a taste, eh? Let's just have a quick swig."
"Burn and blast my bones. Yeah. This'll sink the festivities into deeper waters, all right."
"We need a bigger, wilder party if we want to whet Benweth's appetite."
"What we need is some stew to match our spirits."
"While we're having a good time, clearly the party's not wild enough yet."
"I'm sure this won't involve anything nefarious."
"Let's turn this party hog-wild!"
[Press your lips into a hard line.]
"We've come this far, we should see it through."
"Wouldn't be much fun if it didn't."
"Me and you, buddy, old pal, we share the same soul, I think."
"I never was very good at reading lips." She squints at you for longer than seems necessary, swaying a bit as she stares.
"But not just any stew. It has to be Cookie Maina's specially spiced stew." Elbowing you in the ribs, she winks exaggeratedly.
"Cookie's kitchens are in the northern side of the dungeons, beyond the powder stores. Right in the belly of our fort."
"The lower floor's locked down though, so sneaking past the guards might prove difficult."
"Tell me more about Benweth's harpsichord."
"Guards?"
"Let me ask you about something else."
"He stole it, no surprise there. And he plays it like a god sent from Hel."
"They like debauchery as much as the rest of us, so they might be inclined to leave their posts if they knew what a grand time we're having up here."
"The more booze, the rowdier we Pr√≠ncipi get. The better the booze... well, that's when the real fun starts."
"I happen to know, Deadlight's recently received a shipment of excellent god-killer's rum. It's reserved for Aeldys' private stock."
"Snatch us a barrel, will you? They're outside on the eastern ramparts at the base of the crane."
"Careful, though. The stairs'll be guarded by Benweth's own crew. And they're in a sour mood."
"What will Benweth do if Aeldys' rum is stolen for a party?"
"How can I avoid the guards on the ramparts?"
"I want to talk about something else."
"He'll savor and guzzle it with the rest of us, then later find someone to blame."
"Most direct route to the ramparts is up the stairs by the eastern towers. Ancret's on post there."
"Ben loves him some good festivities. Blood or booze - doesn't matter so long as it's flowing freely."
"Long as it don't get too out of hand, the captain'll probably join us rather than shutting things down."
"Aye, you're likely to find him here from time to time. But at the moment, he's staying uptop in Aeldys' private quarters."
"Oh, you meant because the captain's second in command to Aeldys. When she's off plundering, it's him who runs the Deadlight."
"He's tamping the fort down 'cause he doesn't want to get in trouble with Aeldys again. Last time, we might've got too rowdy..." She snickers into her cup.
"He's brutal when he's sober and he's bloody mad when he drinks. So he's keeping to himself, I'd guess."
"Aeldys ain't a pushover, but she don't like Benny's increasing aggressiveness."
"Damn me, the cup's run dry."
"I might be going cross-eyed. How many fingers am I holding up?"
"Eat hearty, you bone-idle chums! Be merry and wild!"
"How comes it? We're having an uproarious time."
"Drink up, tars! To our better friendship!"
"Wounds and blood! Cleave him to the brisket!"
Entries.female: "Wounds and blood! Cleave her to the brisket!"

Entries.default:
"She's a bit of a gambler. Likes a good bet, but loses more than she ought. 

"I hear Snake Eyes got her for quite a lot of coin. Seems he's good at rigging, and I don't mean sails."
"You mean this god-killer's rum?"
"Why, I think I do." Nearly drooling, she rubs her hands together. She licks at one corner of her mouth as she grins.
"I already have some on hand."
"Well, aren't you trickier than a Siren in the dark." She tries to give you a sly smile, but the quirk's more sloppy than cunning.
She wipes grog from her mouth with the back of one hand.
"Why's that?"
"How do I get there?"
"Well, they're real nice." At your pointed look, she shrugs.
"You don't."
"Ben's locked down the inner halls and the upper ramparts. No one but from his own crew's allowed within."
"But executing all those political prisoners sure was fun."

"You'll have to pardon my lack of wits."

Her lips sheen from her drink when she lazily grins.
"That's why Aeldys is always having to rein him in."
"I know how to get us started, but you'll be doing the leg work. Seeing as I don't fancy a punishment should the captain get mad."
"If he gets out of hand again, she might hang him by his squishy bits from the bowsprit of his own ship."
"I'm listening."
"We get wild enough, and you watch - Ben will even play us some tunes. That's his harpsichord over in the corner."
"Best thing I ever heard aside from a man's moans in my ear. Did you know when you - oh, we were discussing Benny's rapturous fingers, not mine."
"He plays like a hurricane. Night after night. Louder we get, the harder he pounds those keys. He can't help it, the preening sprat."
"Bleed my guts if it wasn't worth it, though."
"You said Benweth would be here. He's not."
"And why would you want to be doing that?" She hiccups.
"To talk."
"He and I have some unfinished business."
"That's what they all say. Think you're the first to want to slide a knife between Ben's ribs?" She shrugs.
"So long as it stays between just you and him..."
"It ain't no skin off of my nose if you want to die."
"Drub me fucking dry... gods..."
"I'm lucky I'm still alive after your stunt."
"What I mean is, it's got a phantasmal kick to it."
"Drub me fucking dry... gods..."
She lets out a long belch.
Mirke hiccups behind her hand.
"Can't say that I am after what you did to Brutal Benny! He's madder than a sea-wasp and will be looking for someone to sting."
After a woesome sigh, she tips back her tankard and drinks deeply.
"Can't say that I am after someone went and killed our Brutal Benny! I'd bet my last bottle of rum, Aeldys flays someone alive when she finds out. "And I'd prefer it not be me."
"You mentioned work?"
"Damn me, the cup's run dry."
